paragraphs.title: Connect to Graph Server
paragraphs.text:
%pgx
import oracle.pgx.api.*
import groovy.json.*

baseUrl = "http://graph-server:7007"
username = "graph_dev"
password = "Welcome1"
keystorePassword = "oracle"

conn = new URL("$baseUrl/auth/token").openConnection()
conn.setRequestProperty('Content-Type', 'application/json')
token = conn.with {
  doOutput = true
  requestMethod = 'POST'
  outputStream.withWriter { writer ->
    writer << JsonOutput.toJson([username: username, password: password])
  }
  return new JsonSlurper().parseText(content.text).access_token
}

instance = Pgx.getInstance(baseUrl, token)
session = instance.createSession("my-session")
session.registerKeystore("/opt/oracle/keystore.p12", keystorePassword.toCharArray())
analyst = session.createAnalyst()

paragraphs.title: Find a Customer with a Few Purchases
paragraphs.text:
%pgx
graph.queryPgql("""
  SELECT ID(c), COUNT(*)
  FROM MATCH (c:Customer)->(p)
  GROUP BY ID(c)
  ORDER BY ID(c) ASC
  LIMIT 10
""")

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Products Purchased by this Customer
paragraphs.text:
%pgx
graph.queryPgql("SELECT ID(c), ID(p), p.description FROM MATCH (c)->(p) WHERE ID(c) = 'cust_12353'")

paragraphs.title: Graph Visualization
paragraphs.text:
%md

Let's assume that a customer, cust_12353, is visiting the web system, and the system needs to calculate the recommended product list.

Run this query on Graph Visualization to see the products purchased by the customer 12353.

```
SELECT *
MATCH (c1)-[e1]->(p1)
WHERE ID(c1) = 'cust_12353'
```

Two hops:

```
SELECT *
MATCH (c1)-[e1]->(p1)<-[e2]-(c2)
WHERE ID(c1) = 'cust_12353'
  AND ID(c1) != ID(c2)
```

Three hops:

```
SELECT *
MATCH (c1)-[e1]->(p1)<-[e2]-(c2)-[e3]->(p2)
WHERE ID(c1) = 'cust_12353'
  AND ID(c1) != ID(c2)
  AND ID(p1) != ID(p2)
```

msg.data:
Let’s assume that a customer, cust_12353, is visiting the web system, and the system needs to calculate the recommended product list.

Run this query on Graph Visualization to see the products purchased by the customer 12353.

SELECT *
MATCH (c1)-[e1]->(p1)
WHERE ID(c1) = 'cust_12353'

Two hops:

SELECT *
MATCH (c1)-[e1]->(p1)<-[e2]-(c2)
WHERE ID(c1) = 'cust_12353'
  AND ID(c1) != ID(c2)

Three hops:

SELECT *
MATCH (c1)-[e1]->(p1)<-[e2]-(c2)-[e3]->(p2)
WHERE ID(c1) = 'cust_12353'
  AND ID(c1) != ID(c2)
  AND ID(p1) != ID(p2)

paragraphs.title: Run Personalized PageRank (PPR)
paragraphs.text:
%pgx
rs = graph.queryPgql("SELECT c MATCH (c:Customer) WHERE ID(c) = 'cust_12353'")
rs.next()
vertex = rs.getVertex(1)
analyst.personalizedPagerank(graph, vertex)

paragraphs.title: Get Top 10 Recommendations
paragraphs.text:
%pgx
graph.queryPgql("""
  SELECT ID(p), p.description, p.pagerank
  MATCH (p)
  WHERE LABEL(p) = 'Product'
    AND NOT EXISTS (
      SELECT *
      MATCH (p)-[:purchased_by]->(c)
      WHERE ID(c) = 'cust_12353'
    )
  ORDER BY p.pagerank DESC
  LIMIT 10
""")

paragraphs.title: Paths to the Top Recommended Product
paragraphs.text:
%pgx
graph.queryPgql("""
  SELECT ID(c), ARRAY_AGG(ID(n1)), ARRAY_AGG(ID(e)), ID(p)
  FROM MATCH TOP 10 SHORTEST ( (c) ((n1) -[e]-> (n2))* (p) )
  WHERE ID(c) = 'cust_12353'
    AND ID(p) = 'prod_23166'
""")

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Intermediate Nodes
paragraphs.text:
%pgx
graph.queryPgql("""
  SELECT DISTINCT p1.description, COUNT(*) AS num_c2
  MATCH (c1)->(p1)<-(c2)->(p2)
  WHERE ID(c1) = 'cust_12353'
    AND ID(p2) = 'prod_23166'
    AND ID(c1) != ID(c2)
    AND ID(p2) != ID(p1)
  GROUP BY p1.description
""")

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]
